intro: Cephaelis herbacea, commonly known as the blue-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate blue or purple flowers and its trailing growth habit, making it popular in hanging baskets and containers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade. Cephaelis herbacea is also valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
